trans-unit.source: Represents the contents of the optional <xref uid="langword_csharp_Subcode" name="Subcode" href=""></xref> element of a SOAP fault when SOAP version 1.2 is used to communicate between a client and an XML Web service.
A SOAP 1.2 fault contains a `Code` element and among other things an optional `Subcode` element.

The `Code` element specifies the type of error that occurred using a limited number of pre-defined error codes specified by the SOAP protocol, whereas the `Subcode` element allows the sender of the SOAP fault to provide an application specific error code.
This class represents the contents of the `Subcode` element.

XML Web services return a SOAP fault by throwing a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException> and.NET clients receive a SOAP fault by catching a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException>.

A <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException> has the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Code%2A> property representing the `Code` element and the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Subcode%2A> property representing the `Subcode` element.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubcode> class sets the application specific error code.
An <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> specifying the application specific error code.
Sets the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubcode.Code*> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubCode"></xref> class setting the application specific error code and additional error information.
An <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> specifying the application specific error code.
Sets the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubCode.Code*> property.
A <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubCode"></xref> specifying additional application specific error information.
Sets the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubCode.SubCode*> property.
Gets the application specific error code in the form of an XML qualified name.
Use a constructor to set the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubcode.Code%2A> property.

The value of the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubcode.Code%2A> property can be any user defined XML qualified name, including the codes represented by the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.Soap12FaultCodes.RpcProcedureNotPresentFaultCode>, <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.Soap12FaultCodes.RpcBadArgumentsFaultCode>, <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.Soap12FaultCodes.EncodingMissingIDFaultCode>, and <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.Soap12FaultCodes.EncodingUntypedValueFaultCode> fields.
An <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> representing the application specific error code.
Gets additional error information contained within a child <xref uid="langword_csharp_Subcode" name="Subcode" href=""></xref> element.
Use a constructor to set the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubcode.Subcode%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubcode.Subcode%2A> property allows an XML Web service to provide nested error information.
This is useful for providing an error code specific to the XML Web service while passing along error information returned from components the XML Web service called.
A <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubcode> containing additional error information.
